intro: Biscutella laevigata proles macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited biscuitroot, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the plant is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils. It is often found in sagebrush steppe and other arid environments.
